quotes.text: I was saying let me out of here before I was even bornâ€”it's such a gamble when you get a face.
Time is a flat circle, cut from paper, burned at the edges.
To me, 'blank' is a line where you can fill in anything.
I wanted to be the first one to know what it felt like to be dead.
The aesthetic was always about removal. Taking away the excess until only the nerve endings remained.
Poetry is the only art form where the materials are free.
You can't write a poem about a tree, but you can be a tree.

books.title: I Dreamed I Was a Very Clean Tramp
books.description: An autobiography covering his childhood, escape to New York, and the punk explosion.

books.title: Go Now
books.description: A novel about a punk musician on a cross-country drive.

books.title: Godlike
books.description: A novel set in the early 70s poetry scene.
